urls.description: Anthony Browne, MP for South Cambridgeshire, is asking residents to engage with a new consultation from the Environment Agency to ensure Cambridge is classed as an area of ‚Äúwater stress‚Äù

tweets.text:
On @BBCCambs soon to discuss a new consultation from @EnvAgency on methodology classifying Cambridgeshire as an area of water stress.

We face serious problems with water shortages, impacting valuable natural resources such as chalk streams. More info üëá
https://t.co/ZfVOs9I2Qq

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW Riparian Tree Fund planting kicked off today on the Fylde Coast. urls.title: Flood Alert, Flood Warning and Severe Flood Warning ‚Äì What‚Äôs the difference? | Newground
urls.description: Recently, I saw a poll on Twitter set up to help the Environment Agency understand people‚Äôs interpretation of flood risk, which is one of the reasons I decided to write this blog. Out of the 1,199 people who voted on the poll, I was quite shocked to find that 51% of voters thought a Flood Alert meant that you were at a higher risk of flooding than a Flood Warning. This is NOT the case. Raising awareness of the flood alerts and warning system and what each stage means is key to educating people and

tweets.text:
Having a 'trigger' to notify you of a #flood BEFORE it happens can allow time to prepare.

The @EnvAgencyNW Flood Warning Service is one such trigger, but do you know what the different stages mean?

Read our blog to learn more: https://t.co/5Hv1sf3FoV

#preparedness #floodaware https://t.co/7SEKTJFMnd
